1.verse: From Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God. God sent me to tell about the promise of life that is in Christ Jesus.

2.verse: To Timothy, a dear child to me: Grace, mercy, and peace to you from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.

3.verse: Encouragement for Timothy - I thank God as I always mention you in my prayers, day and night. I serve him, doing what I know is right as my ancestors did.

4.verse: Remembering that you cried for me, I want very much to see you so I can be filled with joy.

5.verse: I remember your true faith. That faith first lived in your grandmother Lois and in your mother Eunice, and I know you now have that same faith.

6.verse: This is why I remind you to keep using the gift God gave you when I laid my hands on you. Now let it grow, as a small flame grows into a fire.

7.verse: God did not give us a spirit that makes us afraid but a spirit of power and love and self-control.

8.verse: So do not be ashamed to tell people about our Lord Jesus, and do not be ashamed of me, in prison for the Lord. But suffer with me for the Good News. God, who gives us the strength to do that,

9.verse: saved us and made us his holy people. That was not because of anything we did ourselves but because of God’s purpose and grace. That grace was given to us through Christ Jesus before time began,

10.verse: but it is now shown to us by the coming of our Savior Christ Jesus. He destroyed death, and through the Good News he showed us the way to have life that cannot be destroyed.

11.verse: I was chosen to tell that Good News and to be an apostle and a teacher.

12.verse: I am suffering now because I tell the Good News, but I am not ashamed, because I know Jesus, the One in whom I have believed. And I am sure he is able to protect what he has trusted me with until that day.

13.verse: Follow the pattern of true teachings that you heard from me in faith and love, which are in Christ Jesus.

14.verse: Protect the truth that you were given; protect it with the help of the Holy Spirit who lives in us.

15.verse: You know that everyone in Asia has left me, even Phygelus and Hermogenes.

16.verse: May the Lord show mercy to the family of Onesiphorus, who has often helped me and was not ashamed that I was in prison.

17.verse: When he came to Rome, he looked eagerly for me until he found me.

18.verse: May the Lord allow him to find mercy from the Lord on that day. You know how many ways he helped me in Ephesus.

1.verse: A Loyal Soldier of Christ Jesus - You then, Timothy, my child, be strong in the grace we have in Christ Jesus.

2.verse: You should teach people whom you can trust the things you and many others have heard me say. Then they will be able to teach others.

3.verse: Share in the troubles we have like a good soldier of Christ Jesus.

4.verse: A soldier wants to please the enlisting officer, so no one serving in the army wastes time with everyday matters.

5.verse: Also an athlete who takes part in a contest must obey all the rules in order to win.

6.verse: The farmer who works hard should be the first person to get some of the food that was grown.

7.verse: Think about what I am saying, because the Lord will give you the ability to understand everything.

8.verse: Remember Jesus Christ, who was raised from the dead, who is from the family of David. This is the Good News I preach,

9.verse: and I am suffering because of it to the point of being bound with chains like a criminal. But God’s teaching is not in chains.

10.verse: So I patiently accept all these troubles so that those whom God has chosen can have the salvation that is in Christ Jesus. With that salvation comes glory that never ends.

11.verse: This teaching is true: If we died with him, we will also live with him.

12.verse: If we accept suffering, we will also rule with him. If we say we don’t know him, he will say he doesn’t know us.

13.verse: If we are not faithful, he will still be faithful, because he must be true to who he is.

14.verse: A Worker Pleasing to God - Continue teaching these things, warning people in God’s presence not to argue about words. It does not help anyone, and it ruins those who listen.

15.verse: Make every effort to give yourself to God as the kind of person he will approve. Be a worker who is not ashamed and who uses the true teaching in the right way.

16.verse: Stay away from foolish, useless talk, because that will lead people further away from God.

17.verse: Their evil teaching will spread like a sickness inside the body. Hymenaeus and Philetus are like that.

18.verse: They have left the true teaching, saying that the rising from the dead has already taken place, and so they are destroying the faith of some people.

19.verse: But God’s strong foundation continues to stand. These words are written on the seal: “The Lord knows those who belong to him,” and “Everyone who wants to belong to the Lord must stop doing wrong.”

20.verse: In a large house there are not only things made of gold and silver, but also things made of wood and clay. Some things are used for special purposes, and others are made for ordinary jobs.

21.verse: All who make themselves clean from evil will be used for special purposes. They will be made holy, useful to the Master, ready to do any good work.

22.verse: But run away from the evil desires of youth. Try hard to live right and to have faith, love, and peace, together with those who trust in the Lord from pure hearts.

23.verse: Stay away from foolish and stupid arguments, because you know they grow into quarrels.

24.verse: And a servant of the Lord must not quarrel but must be kind to everyone, a good teacher, and patient.

25.verse: The Lord’s servant must gently teach those who disagree. Then maybe God will let them change their minds so they can accept the truth.

26.verse: And they may wake up and escape from the trap of the devil, who catches them to do what he wants.

1.verse: The Last Days - Remember this! In the last days there will be many troubles,

2.verse: because people will love themselves, love money, brag, and be proud. They will say evil things against others and will not obey their parents or be thankful or be the kind of people God wants.

3.verse: They will not love others, will refuse to forgive, will gossip, and will not control themselves. They will be cruel, will hate what is good,

4.verse: will turn against their friends, and will do foolish things without thinking. They will be conceited, will love pleasure instead of God,

5.verse: and will act as if they serve God but will not have his power. Stay away from those people.

6.verse: Some of them go into homes and get control of silly women who are full of sin and are led by many evil desires.

7.verse: These women are always learning new teachings, but they are never able to understand the truth fully.

8.verse: Just as Jannes and Jambres were against Moses, these people are against the truth. Their thinking has been ruined, and they have failed in trying to follow the faith.

9.verse: But they will not be successful in what they do, because as with Jannes and Jambres, everyone will see that they are foolish.

10.verse: Obey the Teachings - But you have followed what I teach, the way I live, my goal, faith, patience, and love. You know I never give up.

11.verse: You know how I have been hurt and have suffered, as in Antioch, Iconium, and Lystra. I have suffered, but the Lord saved me from all those troubles.

12.verse: Everyone who wants to live as God desires, in Christ Jesus, will be persecuted.

13.verse: But people who are evil and cheat others will go from bad to worse. They will fool others, but they will also be fooling themselves.

14.verse: But you should continue following the teachings you learned. You know they are true, because you trust those who taught you.

15.verse: Since you were a child you have known the Holy Scriptures which are able to make you wise. And that wisdom leads to salvation through faith in Christ Jesus.

16.verse: All Scripture is inspired by God and is useful for teaching, for showing people what is wrong in their lives, for correcting faults, and for teaching how to live right.

17.verse: Using the Scriptures, the person who serves God will be capable, having all that is needed to do every good work.

1.verse: I give you a command in the presence of God and Christ Jesus, the One who will judge the living and the dead, and by his coming and his kingdom:

2.verse: Preach the Good News. Be ready at all times, and tell people what they need to do. Tell them when they are wrong. Encourage them with great patience and careful teaching,

3.verse: because the time will come when people will not listen to the true teaching but will find many more teachers who please them by saying the things they want to hear.

4.verse: They will stop listening to the truth and will begin to follow false stories.

5.verse: But you should control yourself at all times, accept troubles, do the work of telling the Good News, and complete all the duties of a servant of God.

6.verse: My life is being given as an offering to God, and the time has come for me to leave this life.

7.verse: I have fought the good fight, I have finished the race, I have kept the faith.

8.verse: Now, a crown is being held for me—a crown for being right with God. The Lord, the judge who judges rightly, will give the crown to me on that day—not only to me but to all those who have waited with love for him to come again.

9.verse: Personal Words - Do your best to come to me as soon as you can,

10.verse: because Demas, who loved this world, left me and went to Thessalonica. Crescens went to Galatia, and Titus went to Dalmatia.

11.verse: Luke is the only one still with me. Get Mark and bring him with you when you come, because he can help me in my work here.

13.verse: When I was in Troas, I left my coat there with Carpus. So when you come, bring it to me, along with my books, particularly the ones written on parchment.

14.verse: Alexander the metalworker did many harmful things against me. The Lord will punish him for what he did.

15.verse: You also should be careful that he does not hurt you, because he fought strongly against our teaching.

16.verse: The first time I defended myself, no one helped me; everyone left me. May they be forgiven.

17.verse: But the Lord stayed with me and gave me strength so I could fully tell the Good News to all those who are not Jews. So I was saved from the lion’s mouth.

18.verse: The Lord will save me when anyone tries to hurt me, and he will bring me safely to his heavenly kingdom. Glory forever and ever be the Lord’s. Amen.

19.verse: Final Greetings - Greet Priscilla and Aquila and the family of Onesiphorus.

20.verse: Erastus stayed in Corinth, and I left Trophimus sick in Miletus.

21.verse: Try as hard as you can to come to me before winter. Eubulus sends greetings to you. Also Pudens, Linus, Claudia, and all the brothers and sisters in Christ greet you.

22.verse: The Lord be with your spirit. Grace be with you.
